article_text:
An inspector general's report released Tuesday accused the Navy of granting access to some of its bases without proper background checks.

The issue of contractors' access to military installations has become a central question in the wake of the shooting rampage Monday at the Washington Navy Yard. Aaron Alexis, a military contractor who worked at the Navy Yard, allegedly shot and killed 12 people before being killed by police.

...

twitter.description: An inspector general's report released Tuesday accused the Navy of granting access to some of its bases without proper background checks, a day after a Washington shooting killed 12 people.
twitter.title: Report Faults Navy's Base-Access Vetting

article_summary:
Aaron Alexis, a military contractor who worked at the Navy Yard, allegedly shot and killed 12 people before being killed by police.
An inspector general's report released Tuesday accused the Navy of granting access to some of its bases without proper background checks.
The issue of contractors' access to military installations has become a central question in the wake of the shooting rampage Monday at the Washington Navy Yard.
